subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Legion of Doom vs. Masters of Deception
description: A quick, practical guide to The Legion of Doom vs. Masters of Deception.

hook.text: Two rival hacker gangs waged a digital war in the late 1980s that ended with FBI investigations.

buildup.text: The Legion of Doom (LOD) and Masters of Deception (MOD) competed for elite status on BBS networks.

discovery.text: Their rivalry escalated from pranks to wiretapping each other's phone lines and crashing systems.

twist.text: MOD members were eventually arrested. The case revealed how personal ego drove most early hacking.

climax.text: The gang war showed that hacking culture was as much about status as it was about technology.

punchline.text: The first cyber war was fought over bragging rights.

quiz.question: What motivated the LOD vs. MOD hacker rivalry?
